channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: The Morning After: You can hang up Lenovo's new tablet
item.description: Today’s headlines: YouTube took down videos documenting Xinjiang human rights abuses, Lenovo's new Yoga Tabs have kickstands that double as hangers, and Apple may be exploring even bigger iPad designs.

item.title: Autonomous Mission Master XT can haul over a ton of supplies into war zones
item.description: Armies want autonomous vehicles to reduce the risk and workload for soldiers, and a new model is a prime example of how that will work.

item.title: The world's fastest electric motorcycle has a new aerodynamic challenger
item.description: White Motorcycle Concepts is targeting an Electric motorcycle land speed record with its WMC250EV concept.

item.title: LG TVs will soon gain dedicated support for Facebook's Portal TV
item.description: LG has made it easier to install Facebook's Portal TV on its webOS-powered TVs thanks to a new firmware update.

item.title: 'Dune' release gets pushed back another three weeks to October 22nd
item.description: If you've been waiting impatiently to see Denis Villeneuve's much anticipated Dune film, you're going to have to wait a bit longer.

item.title: Lenovo's Yoga Tab 13 and 11 have kickstands that double as hangers
item.description: The company unveiled a fresh slate of tablets at Mobile World Congress.

item.title: Lenovo’s $90 Smart Clock 2 includes a wireless charging pad
item.description: Lenovo's Smart Clock 2 offers some improvements for $90. It also comes with a wireless charging pad that's also a nightlight.

item.title: Apple lists the devices you should keep away from your pacemaker
item.description: Apple has outlined the productsthat could interfere with pacemakers and other medical devices, and they include much more than just the iPhone 12.

item.title: Samsung's Galaxy Buds 2 might sport a slicker, more colorful design
item.description: A leak suggests Samsung will release Galaxy Buds 2 with a considerably sleeker design — and punchier colors.

item.title: Venmo will let you sell goods through your personal account
item.description: Venmo will soon let you sell goods through a personal account, although you'll have to pay a fee.

item.title: UK watchdog bans cryptocurrency exchange Binance (updated)
item.description: The UK's financial watchdog has banned Binance's cryptocurrency exchange in the UK,

item.title: China shares video and audio from its Mars rover
item.description: China has shared video footageand audio from its Mars rover Zhurong, giving another look at what it's like to explore the Red Planet.

item.title: Microsoft signed a driver loaded with rootkit malware
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that it signed a driver containing malware, although it stressed the limited real-world security impact.

item.title: Apple is reportedly exploring iPad designs with supersized displays
item.description: Apple is reportedly looking into iPads with larger screens than the already-big 12.9-inch iPad Pro.

item.title: Improve your typing speed and accuracy with this $50 tool
item.description: Lightkey Pro is a smart real-time text predictor that can also correct your spelling and grammar.

item.title: CRISPR gene editing breakthrough could treat many more diseases
item.description: Researchers have discovered that you can inject CRISPR gene editing directly into the bloodstream, potentially leading to effective treatments for many diseases.

item.title: Android developers will get larger sales cuts if they support devices beyond phones
item.description: Google has rolled out a worldwide program that gives Android developers a larger cut of sales if they support tablets, watches, and other non-phone devices.

item.title: YouTube took down videos documenting Xinjiang human rights abuses
item.description: YouTube took down a string of videos documenting human rights abuses in China's Xinjiang province, and the reasoning isn't necessarily clear.

item.title: VW will stop selling combustion engine cars in Europe by 2035
item.description: VW says it will end sales of gas and diesel engine cars in Europe by 2035, although the end will come later in the US.

item.title: ICYMI: Toyota's 2021 Sienna is a stress-free people mover
item.description: Engadget's tech reviews this week include the 2021 Toyota Sienna minivan, the HP Elite Folio laptop and the OnePlus Nord N200 5G.

item.title: SpaceX plans to launch its first orbital Starship test flight in July
item.description: SpaceX says it hopes to launch its first orbital Starship test flight in July, although that's assuming everything stays on track.

item.title: Tesla Autopilot issue leads to 'recall' of nearly 300,000 cars in China
item.description: Tesla is 'recalling' almost 300,000 Model 3 and Y cars in China due to Autopilot complaints.

item.title: Simplify your home audio with a $300 Yamaha soundbar and subwoofer
item.description: The Yamaha ATS-2090 features a 36-inch soundbar and a wireless subwoofer that have a streamlined, simple setup.

item.title: Microsoft customer support rep compromised by hackers behind SolarWinds breach
item.description: The group behind the SolarWinds hacks launched another cyberattack campaign, and one of the victims was a Microsoft customer support agent.

item.title: Verizon seems to be making its own Alexa-based smart display
item.description: The device will use 'Hey, Verizon' as the wake word, according to FCC filings.
